name: Martin Kearn
slogan: I'm into web, cognitive and the cloud
bio: Martin is a technical evangelist for Microsoft based in the UK. In his role, Martin talks with customers, partners, start-ups and anyone who is willing to listen about developing applications on the Microsoft platform. This includes Windows, Office, Microsoft Azure and Web technologies including ASP.net and the Edge browser. Martin has been working with Microsoft development technologies since the late 90's and has been working for Microsoft directly since 2005.

name: Amy Nicholson
slogan: I'm into Data Science, Machine Learning and the cloud
bio: Amy Nicholson is a Technical Evangelist at Microsoft UK having obtained a degree in Computer Science. She is passionate about Data Science, Machine Learning and IoT. Amy helps customers to envision, design and build their cloud solutions. You will find her sharing content online and at in person events

name: Pete Daukintis
slogan: [vr | ar | mr]
bio: Pete D. is a technical evangelist for Microsoft based in the UK. Having started out in 3D Graphics Pete has since made a return to this field of software coincident with the resurgence of the various alternative 'realities'. Currently engaging with the tech community and working on projects using this tech with one eye focussed on the future.

name: Mike Taulty
slogan: I do some developer stuff for Microsoft UK
bio: Mike Taulty works in the Developer and Platform Group at Microsoft in the UK where he has spent the past few years helping developers understand and get the best from the Microsoft platform. Prior to this, Mike spent 3 years with Microsoft Consulting Services as a consultant on developer technologies. Before joining Microsoft, Mike spent the previous 9 years working as a software developer for a number of enterprises, consultancies and software vendors working with a variety of operating system, client, communication and server technologies. You can find more of a complete career history over on LinkedIn. Mike holds a BSc Hons (1st Class) in Computer Science from the University of Leeds.

name: Joni Collinge
slogan: Azure developer - I talk about code...
bio: Joni is a Technical Evangelist at Microsoft. He currently works with a range of customers to build next generation cloud systems which go beyond the capabilities of traditional infrastructure. His background is as a Software Engineer, working on both the Microsoft and OSS stacks. This has driven his passion for bridging the gap between the two traditionally distinct worlds and encouraging openness within Microsoft.

name: Andrew Fryer
slogan: Talk to me about data
bio: Andrew has been working in Business Intelligence and analytics for over twenty years. Most of this has been on the Microsoft platform especially the SQL Server ecosystem.  However for the last couple of years his focus has been big data and analytics on the Azure platform, including Machine Learning, and the various tools for managing and analysing big data.  He regularly present to community groups on the latest Microsoft cognitive technologies. He also hosts TechDays Online which regularly gets over ten thousand viewers watching the live stream

name: Will Eastbury
slogan: Hardcore Azure Architect
bio: Will Eastbury works as a Technical Evangelist on the Microsoft Developer Experience team in the UK specialising in Azure. Will helps people to build and develop applications on the Azure platform. Will has been working with Microsoft development technologies since the mid 90's (Since Visual Basic 3.0) and has been working for Microsoft helping developers build and migrate cloud applications since 2014.

name: Simon Michael
slogan: Conversation as a Platform, Bots, Cortana, Cognitive Services’
bio: Simon is a Senior Technical Evangelist within the Developer Experiences (DX) team at Microsoft UK. He has worked with UK developers and companies to help them understand and get the best from the Microsoft Platform. His current focus is the bot framework, cognitive services and conversations-as-a-service. Simon holds a BSc (hons) and PhD in Computer Science.

name: Martin Beeby
slogan: A Developer Working at Microsoft as a Technical Evangelist
bio: Martin Beeby works for Microsoft where he talks to developers about HTML5, Windows 10 and the web. Martin has been developing since he was 16 and over the past 17 years has worked on projects with many Major brands. Martin has written articles for, and been featured in, NET Magazine, Creative Bloq, SitePoint,  ZDNet, the Microsoft Developer Network, and many more.

name: Andrew Spooner
slogan: Technical Evangelism Lead at Microsoft UK
bio: Andrew is a Technical Evangelist and futurist at Microsoft where he leads a team of Technical Evangelists working with the next generation of hardware and software. He has been building, designing & producing digital products for almost 20 years, always with a focus on the future use and ethics of new technology (although you could question the ethics of the 5 years he spent working in advertising). He champions the use of technology for good causes and to transform the lives of people in need.

name: Marcus Robinson
slogan: I do DevOps with lots of Ops and a little Dev
bio: Marcus Robinson is a Technical Evangelist who focuses on writing and talking about DevOps practices to technical audiences throughout the UK. For the 12 years prior to joining Microsoft Marcus was the managing of an managed IT services company based in Leeds. In recent years Marcus has assisted many organisations with the migration of services from traditional on premises environments to the public cloud. He has become an a recognised expert in technologies such as Windows Server and Microsoft Azure.

name: Lee Stott
slogan: I'm into education and technology
bio: Lee’s role is all about working with UK Academic to secure the future of the Microsoft platform to determine what our technical engagement looks like and to then work with our UK Technical Evangelist teams to have them support initiatives on/off campus.

name: Jamie Dalton
slogan: C#er, Maker and Breaker
bio: Jamie Dalton works as a technical evangelist in the UK, helping customers and partners develop solutions based on the Microsoft platform. He really is as old as he looks, with over 20 years’ experience as a Microsoft software developer.  He is passionate about Application Lifecycle Management, developer tooling, DevOps and creating new experiences using Microsoft technologies in the cloud.  He has a degree from the university of life and once read some books.

name: Paul Foster
slogan: Applied IoT, MPC, Cognitive, Maker
bio: Since joining Microsoft in 1994, Paul Foster has worked across a wide range of sectors and customers, providing a mix of technical and strategic guidance around the creative use of technology in relation to their business needs. As an established public speaker across Europe and having spent a considerable amount of time working on the cutting edge of technology providing leadership and inspiration on topics like Smart Devices, Cloud Computing, Education and App Development. Paul is currently working as a Technical Evangelist for Microsoft UK’s Developer Evangelism Group (DX), focusing on the building of next generation IoT solutions, and the cognitive services they enable to start a new era of perception and automation. For a short time Paul was a member of a high-wire flying trapeze circus troupe, is a keen roboticist and an international marathon runner.

name: Robert Hogg
slogan: Managing Director @ Black Marble
bio: Robert began his career in IT in the 1980s, and in 1997 was a founding member of Black Marble. He has extensive experience in a broad spectrum of disciplines, including multi-platform development, software design, encryption systems, integration solutions and innovative technologies.

name: Wes Hackett
slogan: CTO at AddIn365
bio: Hi my name is Wes Hackett, I’m a SharePoint MVP and a Chief Technical Officer at AddIn365 focused on SharePoint and other Microsoft technologies.

name: David Gristwood
slogan: Azure, Azure and Azure
bio: David Gristwood works as technical evangelist at Microsoft in the UK where he has spent his time helping developers and technical folk understand and get the best from the Microsoft platform. He works as architect with deep technical skills in Microsoft Azure and the Microsoft cloud platform, primarily working with partners who are looking to design and build new and innovative solutions on the cloud. Prior to Microsoft, David secured a Distinction in Computing Science at Newcastle University, worked as a freelance computer journalist, a visiting lecturer at Sunderland University, a director of a software company, as well has having designed and developed a wide range of software solutions, from warehouse to financial systems, over the years, going back to the days of the Commodore PET computer.

name: Rob Fraser
slogan: Things to Come
bio: Rob joined Microsoft in 2011 as Cloud CTO and now considers himself to have the best job in the world leading UK Technical Evangelism. Prior to Microsoft, Rob was a founder and CTO of RiskMetrics Group, a highly successful Financial Services Software-as-a-Service technology firm and was part of the Microsoft Customer Advisory Board on Cloud Computing. Originally an Aerospace Engineering apprentice at BAE Systems, Rob has a PhD in Artificial Intelligence.

name: Richard Fennell
slogan: Engineering Director @ Black Marble
bio: Richard is the Engineering Director at Black Marble Ltd, a Microsoft Gold Partner based in the North of England. He specialises in ALM and DevOps consultancy and is a regular presenter at events in the UK and further afield.

name: Allan Mitchell
slogan: Cloud, loud and proud
bio: Allan Mitchell is the CIO of Elastabytes, a Microsoft Gold Partner.  Allan is also a Microsoft Most Valuable professional (Data Platform) and has written books on SSIS in SQL Server 2005 and 2008 as well as being the technical reviewer on many more.  Allan manages a team of Azure engineers responsible for helping customers move their workloads to the Azure cloud.  His team also manages those customers in Azure offering dedicated 24*7*365 monitoring and support.  Elastabytes operates in a number of verticals and had one of the first customers to use the UK Azure data centres.

name: Elton Stoneman
slogan: Helping to Dockerize the Microsoft world
bio: Elton is an Azure MVP, Docker Captain and Pluralsight Author. He built his career delivering successful solutions with Microsoft technologies, most recently Big Data implementations in Azure and distributed systems with Docker. Elton is a regular presenter at events and user groups - in 2016 he spoke at Microsoft's Future Decoded and TechDays Online, at the WinOps Conference, and at the Docker London and London DevOps meetups. He's always happy to have the chance to go somewhere new and talk about Docker.

name: Tarun Arora
slogan: Coach, Author, Speaker, DevOps Hero
bio: Tarun Arora works as an ALM & DevOps consultant for Avanade UK, helping software development teams deliver better quality software… faster. Tarun is a Microsoft MVP in Visual Studio Development Tools, he is also an author & speaker, his recently publication TFS 2015 DevOps & ALM Cookbook has raving reviews. Tarun Arora (@arora_tarun) is obsessed with high-quality working software, continuous delivery, and Agile practices. He has experience managing technical programs, implementing digital strategy, and delivering quality @ scale.

name: Andy Cross
slogan: The Future, through AI and Data
bio: Andy Cross is a co-founder of Elastacloud. An international speaker, delivering awesome talks on Data and applications at scale. Andy has lead teams building the largest Hadoop and HDInsight specialist deployments on Azure. His passion for embedded software and high performance compute clusters gives him a unique insight into a sphere of computation from the very small and resource constrained to the massively scalable, limitless potential of the cloud. He is the co-founder of the UK London Azure User Group, an Azure Most Valuable Professional and a Microsoft Regional Director. You can tweet Andy at @andyelastacloud.

name: Richard Conway
slogan: Azure, Data Science, Data Platform
bio: Richard Conway is an Azure MVP and Microsoft Regional Director. With a wealth of experience around data platform and Azure he co-founded both Elastacloud and the UK Azure Users Group to help customers and community members with best practice on cloud and data.

name: Rik Hepworth
slogan: IT Director at Black Marble by day, tech evangelist by night
bio: Rik is a Microsoft MVP for Azure and IT Director at Black Marble, an award-winning company in the north of England. His role includes delivering robust IT solutions to both his own organisation and its customers, which can take in a broad spectrum of technologies. An enthusiastic technology evangelist, Rik is a regular presenter at events around Europe.

name: Steph Locke
slogan: Making numbers mean stuff!
bio: Steph Locke leads a life of data, coffee, books and board games. During the day, Steph’s a data scientist for CensorNet and works on implementing useful analytical solutions to keep organisations safe. In her spare time, Steph tries to help others work with data better by providing platforms for knowledge sharing and sharing her own knowledge.

name: Garry Whittaker
slogan: Everything Xamarin and Mobile
bio: Garry, a Microsoft MVP, is Director of App Development for AppXib Ltd a Xamarin Authorised Consultancy. Garry talks regularly on Xamarin and as a claim to fame was the first person outside Xamarin to complete the Xamarin Certification course in under two weeks. Garry has been in the IT industry for too long to talk about but his first real job was programming the same computer that sent man to the moon. He has been involved in mobile development a long time as well and says the first mobile system he worked on had to be pulled on a trolley. He is bang up to date though and will be shortly guest lecturing on Xamarin for University College London.

name: Stuart Leeks
slogan: This web thing might take off...
bio: By day, Stuart Leeks is a Technical Evangelist working for Microsoft in the UK. He has worked with a wide range of customers from small ISVs to large enterprises to help them be successful building on the Microsoft technology stack. Whilst Stuart has experience of a diverse set of technologies, he is most passionate about the web and cloud. Stuart is a web geek, cloud nut, performance & scalability enthusiast, father of three, husband, salsa dancer & teacher, and loves bad puns. He has been writing code since the days of the BBC Micro and still gets a kick out of it!

name: Jon Maunder
slogan: Securing and managing digital transformation with Microsoft Cloud
bio: Jon is a technology solutions guy at Microsoft. He spends his days talking to customers, partners and the wider community about the positive impact of Microsoft technology in business – making organisations more productive and keeping operations secure. But he’s not all talk. Jon has hands-on experience implementing Microsoft solutions from his time partner-side. He gets under the skin of new technology by learning from the ground up. His goal: to help others see the big picture and get real value from their digital transformation journey.

name: João Pedro 'jota' Martins
slogan: PaaSsion for Azure Cloud
bio: João ('jota') has almost 20 years of experience in IT, having been the CTO of a 25p Microsoft-certified 'gourmet' systems integrator, a BizTalk MVP and founder of both the portuguese software architect group and the portuguese usability professional's association. Has a strong appdev background in the Microsoft space and has done multiple speaking engagements in topics ranging from Software Estimation to Scrum to Azure Service Fabric or the early 'red dog' Service Bus, to name a few.

name: Galiya Warrier
slogan: Bots, Cognitive services, Data on Azure
bio: Galiya is a Data Solution Architect working for Microsoft in the UK since 2015. In her role, she spends most of her time working with customers who have been using Azure cloud and are looking forward to get the most benefits out of it - either by developing new exciting projects while using latest Azure Data services and products, that will differentiate them from competition, or by exploring & enhancing existing workloads available on-premises or in the cloud to save some costs & discover more insights about the data already available within the organisation.

name: Barbara Fusinska
slogan: Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and once again Data!
bio: Barbara is a Data Solution Architect with strong software development background. While working with a variety of different companies, she gained experience in building diverse software systems. This experience brought her focus to the Data Science and Big Data field. She believes in the importance of the data and metrics when growing a successful business. Alongside collaborating around data architectures, Barbara still enjoys programming activities. Currently speaking at conferences in-between working in London.

name: Gary Pretty
slogan: Bot Framework, Conversation as a Platform and Cognitive Services
bio: Gary is a Microsoft MVP and a Senior Developer / Technical Strategist at Mando, where he has spent the last 7 years of his career helping to spot emerging technologies and how they can help clients in the real world, with a strong emphasis on improving user experience. He works with technologies across the Microsoft stack, but is particularly passionate about Bot Framework, Microsoft Cognitive Services, and Conversation as a Platform. Gary is also the founder of the annual Stacked developer conference in the North of England. You can find gary on twitter @garypretty

name: Robin Osborne
slogan: Azure, Bots, Web Dev, & Web Perf Optimization
bio: Robin is an experienced VP engineering, Head of Development, Software Development Manager, Team Leader, Architect, Analyst, and Developer who has implemented, designed, supported, and defined development strategies for high availability, highly transactional systems within strict time-scales and expanding scope. He’s a Microsoft MVP, specialising in the design and development of Chatbots, the use of Azure, and also in Web Performance Optimisation. Robin also creates and delivers training courses, and speaks at meetups and conferences on subjects ranging from being a professional developer or technical manager, Web development and performance optimisation, through to Azure development best practices and Chatbot design and development.

name: Christos Matskas
slogan: All about .NET, Azure and Open Source
bio: Christos Matskas is a software developer, blogger, speaker and all around geek. He currently works at Microsoft as an Azure Premier Field Engineer. Before joining Microsoft, he was a successful entrepreneur and had the chance to collaborate with companies such as MarkIT, Lockheed Martin and Barclays. He's been building software for over 12 years and he's a passionate Open Source advocate. He contributes regularly to numerous OSS projects and works closely with the community to make the developer space bigger and better.

name: Gary Short
slogan: Data scientist, machine learning and predictive analytics specialist
bio: Gary Short is a Data Solution Architect for Microsoft. He specialises in machine learning and “big data” on the Azure Platform, but has an interest in data science, in all forms, especially computational linguistics and social network analysis.

name: Chris Testa-O'Neill
slogan: Bringing clarity about the Cortana Intelligence Suite to the world
bio: Chris Testa-O'Neill works in the Analytics and Data Science team at Microsoft based out of the UK, working with the Cortana Intelligence Suite (CIS) and Microsoft R Server.
